review: lovely systems heavy rpg heavily recommend to any crpg enjoyer

i wish this game stuck the landing a robust skill system that allows a character so inclined to never directly fight anyone is a very cool concept for me however this creates some pacing problems as there is not enough content in the game to really support this playstyle combat is tough and requires a character heavily invested in it to survive an interesting world and lore get it on sale

this game rules its a brutal grimdark world with unforgiving everything npcs play by the same rules as you do so no chosen hero bullcrap here there is little loyalty to go around and pretty much everyone doesnt like you and is trying to get one over on you but with cunning and guile or just raw combat prowess see what life you can make for yourself in the age of decadence

this game occupies the same place in my mind as the original fallout games  old graphics incredible game ive invested so much time in getting different endings and paths and i havent even done half of them seriously old school peak

very unique setting some of the best writing i have ever seen in games and allows me to play a doublecrossing master of disguise who just convinces everyone and never has to fight excited to replay as a soldier and update this review
perfect for my flavour of tism

you will feel pain desperation and then you will be ecstatic that you managed to kill that hobo with a knife on your own add the best lore that ive seen in a video game ever and dialogue that makes sense and you will get your rpg awesomeness that is aod buy it hate it love it come back to it once in a while for more intrigue and mysteries
one of the most unique crpgs with very interesting setting and story there are many paths and solutions to every quest expect a little jank
unique game in a very cool setting
i am not one typically for these turn based and simple graphic rpgs however aod has been a great and joyful introduction to the genre and i am really quite fond of the game

cheat up your stats and ignore the boring lore as a combat character then its pretty enjoyable but if thats not your style you can also do a diplomacylore build with marked solve quest buttons and beeing regularly punished with wiki articles

one of the best if not the best crpg i have ever played reminds me of both interplays fallouts top notch world building extreme replayability strong characters and dialogues the setting is amazingly original and gameplay although dated still holds strong it might be a bit difficult for people to try it out it was build on torque engine after all but if you love rpgs of old days give it a try and you will not regret i promise you  highly recommended
wish i knew about this game sooner
game is meant to be played multiple times youll never find everything even after 5 runs its brutal and looks ugly but its addictive and the story is deep
kinda ok but too many bugs

for a very narrow audience
interesting game few bugs here and there but overall i like it i hope there will be something like this in better engine i like this kind of games
took me 8 hours or so to beat as a merchant very fun game with an interesting narrative only killed one person and by the end of the game i killed a godnot included in the above count

i died in my first battle so i started over did a playthrough by talking my way through everything and had a freakin blast based on a playthrough with no battles i 100 recommend but if you plan on doing a playthrough with battles be warned its insanely challenging  my playstyle gave me lots of planescape tormenttorment tides of numenera vibes

great story ugly graphics read a bit about builds and save character points for later  game is made to have big replayability potential thing is no one gonna replay it 5 times these days dont cockblock yourself from options my man beside of that one of most original and interesting worlds created in crpgs bit tiresome to replay same arthurian fantasy for 100th time highly recommend
gritty and realistic dont start combat unless you really mean it combat is dangerous and deadly when necessary use every advantage you can
solid rpg as long as you dont mind having to reload a ton

while it sometimes feels a little clunky by modern standards i enjoyed the game mainly because i like old school crpgs and i enjoy using speech skills in rpgs in general this game is definitely not for everyone and combat should be avoided as much as possible still if you like a unique setting and a substantial challenge in an unforgiving universe youll enjoy this its clear the developers put a lot of thought and effort into it and i look forward to seeing what they release next
difficult but fun

this game has a very interesting setting wich contributes greatly to its story and the many choices it asks you to make the combat is good but unforgiving dont expect to demolish every enemies from the get go though it is very satisfying when you finally make it through difficult battles i wholeheartedly recommend the game

this game promises to be a turnbased rpg with strategy and multiple choices but instead we get a visual novel with a bad story and characters who are all more hateful than the last above all its very frustrating how easy it is to mess up your build you spend your time dying in combat and starting over again and again

old fashioned crpg combat is very simple compared to poe or divinity but there is a lot to master graphics are bare boned but story is excellent would recommend to anyone who enjoys turn based combat with an engaging story
a unique  experience that changed the way i look at the entire crpg genre that being said unique also means that it might not be for everyone so be sure to check the demo
super replayable crpg made with lots of passion from the devs
really great crpg game with dark atmosphere thx to iron tower studio for work

wonderful breadth of choice chains and actually wellwritten npcs with motivations that make sense  its a bit janky but pretty reliable  loved it  definitely worth replaying for the variety  absolutely recommend  note turn your lighting setting to low on modern machines to get rid of the flickering

these devs are some of the best devs in the business updates fair prices and near full transparency with their fans very rare these days  if you havent played one of their games you should their next game is going to be the creme de la creme so its best you learn the playstyle for these types of turnbased strategy rpgs asap
good

old school rpg with good worldbuilding taking place in a believable universe multiple distinct starting backgrounds for player character that provide good replayability combat is mediocre but it doesnt have to be a huge path of your playthrough as the game lets you play a pc who is not a murderhobo overall age of decadence is an excellent example of a quality indie rpg

amazing the difficulty is very difficult but man is it rewarding to progress i spend about 45 hours on the game with vivid memories i might even reinstall and do another run through now that i am thinking about it

after 2 months and 100  absolutely amazing the setting is incredibly gripping and the faction campaigns are well worth multiple playthroughs i was completely hooked the moment i realized the game is complex enough as to have both a way to finish the game without a single fight or kill as well as room for a headhunting spacemarine run

a worthwhile gem that merits your attention incredible character build customisation and engrossing combat in a fascinating world highly recommended

great game crazy time sink start the game at 9pm hoping to sleep by midnight all the death and reruns like the anime rezero will time machine you to next morning game is hella hard and i had to read a guide to finish a playthrough with countless deaths saveload still its kind of like pathfinder but way more hardcore
